question: How long is the term of office for the President in the Federation of Pakistan?
Which country's constitution is being discussed in the text?
How many members can the Cabinet of the Provincial Assembly have according to the Constitution?
According to the constitution who will be guilty of high treason?
How the constitution is securing child labour?
answer:
The term of office for the President in the Federation of Pakistan is five years from the day he enters upon his office. Additionally, a person holding office as President is eligible for re-election to that office, but no person shall hold that office for more than two consecutive terms.
The constitution being discussed in the text is that of Pakistan.
The Cabinet of the Provincial Assembly can have up to fifteen members or eleven percent of the total membership of a Provincial Assembly, whichever is higher, according to the Constitution.
According to the Constitution of Pakistan, anyone who abrogates, subverts, suspends, or holds in abeyance the Constitution by use of force or show of force or by any other unconstitutional means shall be guilty of high treason. Additionally, any person aiding, abetting, or collaborating with such acts will also be guilty of high treason.
The constitution secures child labor by prohibiting the engagement of children below the age of fourteen years in any factory, mine, or any other hazardous employment. It also ensures just and humane conditions of work, specifically stating that children and women should not be employed in vocations unsuited to their age or sex. Additionally, the constitution mandates the State to provide free and compulsory education to all children of the age of five to sixteen years, which indirectly supports the prevention of child labor by ensuring children are in school.

Islamic Republic of Pakistan
The total strength of the Cabinet,including Ministers of State, shall not exceed eleven percent of the total membership of Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament).

Any person who abrogates or subverts or suspends or holds in abeyance, or attempts or conspires to abrogate or subvert or suspend or hold in abeyance, the Constitution by use of force or show of force or by any other unconstitutional meanshall be guilty of high treason.
No child below the age of fourteen years shall be engaged in any factory or mine or any other hazardous employment.
